content.original: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. So it turns out the docking cradles were salvaged for parts and scrap, but the mounting points are still intact. I can get my techs to work fabricating new 'Mech cradles commander, but it's gonna take a while to get everything rebuilt. I think there's enough pieces left behind to get one assembled quickly, though.
content.prevOriginal: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. So it turns out the docking cradles were salvaged for parts and scrap, but the mounting points are still intact. content.content: Repaired Drop Bay 1

content.original: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. The first cradle turned out alright, Boss. There's enough scrap left lying around we should be able to construct the bones of a gantry for the next, but we're also gonna need to buy several complex components to get the next cradle ready for use.
content.prevOriginal: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. The first cradle turned out alright, Boss. content.original: Repaired Drop Bay 2
content.prevOriginal: Repaired Drop Bay 2
content.content: Repaired Drop Bay 2

content.original: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. Half-done now, Boss. It's really starting to look like a proper dropship. I can get started on fabricating parts to assemble the final 2 cradles from scratch. Producing the parts in duplicate should save us a little time and money.
content.prevOriginal: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. Half-done now, Boss. It's really starting to look like a proper dropship. I can get started on fabricating parts to assemble the final 2 cradles from scratch. Producing the parts in duplicate should save us a little time and money.

content.original: Repaired Drop Bay 3
content.prevOriginal: Repaired Drop Bay 3
content.content: Repaired Drop Bay 3

content.original: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. There's more to dropping a lance of BattleMechs from orbit than strapping them to a wall, Commander. Several of the gyros and handling sensors around the ship are damaged or downright missing. If we try to insert the ship from orbit with anything less than an absolutely perfectly balanced load, there's a very real chance we could lose the shuttle and all aboard. We'll need to replace and recalibrate those systems through some test drops before we can make full use of the new Leopard, Commander.
content.prevOriginal: Enables to Drop 1 additional Mech or Tank. There's more to dropping a lance of BattleMechs from orbit than strapping them to a wall, Commander. content.original: We managed to find someone selling a junked Leopard, Commander. The seller says it 'ran when parked'. If we can get it fully operational again, we'd be able to drop some Heavy Metal! Allows you to drop 2 additional Battle Armor

content.original: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. Further Repairs on the Leopard's Mechbays allows to store some Equipment on it

content.original: Allows you to Drop an Additional Vehicle The Command and Control systems were never really intended to support a Light Company's worth of 'Mechs, Commander. If we want to maintain communications with our pilots, we'll need to upgrade our communication networks to deal with the additional bandwidth.

content.original: Allows you to Drop an Additional Vehicle The upgrades continue, Commander. Interfacing this Star League technology with our own C&C systems is proving challenging, but there's no problem more money and time can't fix, right?

content.original: The shuttle was allowed to go to rust sitting in the junkyard, Commander. Most parts of the Leopard's basic structure consist of little more than rust and hope. My 'techs can get to work repairing the worst of the damage, but I warn you now, to complete all of the work will be a long process. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons
content.prevOriginal: The shuttle was allowed to go to rust sitting in the junkyard, Commander. Most parts of the Leopard's basic structure consist of little more than rust and hope. content.original: The good news is that the 'Mechs probably won't fall out of their cradles when the Leopard launches, so now we can get started on making sure they won't fall through the floor. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons

content.prevOriginal: Engine Repairs

content.original: Turns out the engine mounts are almost completely rusted away Commander. We're gonna need to rebuild them before we can start fixing the engines, otherwise they'll rip themselves out under too much stress. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons
content.prevOriginal: Turns out the engine mounts are almost completely rusted away Commander. We're gonna need to rebuild them before we can start fixing the engines, otherwise they'll rip themselves out under too much stress. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons

content.original: Engine Repairs
content.prevOriginal: Engine Repairs
content.content: Engine Repairs

content.original: The Leopard has lost a lot of engine power over the years rusting away. As it stands, getting down to the planet won't be a problem but it'd be a one way trip with the engines in their current state. I'll help Yang get started on repairing the worst of the damage. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons

content.original: The engine work continues, Commander. We've almost got those engines back up to their rated output. A little more tweaking should do it. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons
content.prevOriginal: The engine work continues, Commander. We've almost got those engines back up to their rated output. A little more tweaking should do it. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons

content.original: Engine Repairs
content.prevOriginal: Engine Repairs
content.content: Engine Repairs

content.original: Now that the engines and structure are back up to snuff, the next step is to recalibrate the control systems to correctly handle the balance and performance changes that our repairs have caused. We'll need to do a series of orbital drops to accurately gauge the handling characteristics and then punch them into the onboard flight systems. Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons
content.prevOriginal: Now that the engines and structure are back up to snuff, the next step is to recalibrate the control systems to correctly handle the balance and performance changes that our repairs have caused. content.original: Engine Repairs
content.prevOriginal: Engine Repairs
content.content: Engine Repairs

content.original: The good news is we're almost at the finish line. Frankly, I never thought we'd get this far, Boss. I've been putting this off so far because of the necessary time and money, but the spine of the ship was bent either during it's past service or while it was rotting away in the junkyard. We're going to have to completely tear down the ship to expose the structural skeleton to complete the work, but after this it will be as good as new! Increases Drop Weight Limit by 50 tons

content.original: The Argo's drive was enough to get it off the surface of a low-gravity moon, but much of the supporting infrastructure was damaged in the escape, and running the drive at full power requires extensive repairs. Once the repairs are complete, the drive can generate 1.5 g of thrust.
content.prevOriginal: The Argo's drive was enough to get it off the surface of a low-gravity moon, but much of the supporting infrastructure was damaged in the escape, and running the drive at full power requires extensive repairs. Once the repairs are complete, the drive can generate 1.5 g of thrust.

content.original: Drive Repairs
content.prevOriginal: Drive Repairs
content.content: Drive Repairs

content.original: The Argo can, in a pinch, generate quite a bit more thrust than it first seemed. By repairing a number of drive subsystems meant to increase thrust efficiency, it’s possible to get the Argo up to an uncomfortable 2 g of sustained thrust.
content.prevOriginal: The Argo can, in a pinch, generate quite a bit more thrust than it first seemed. By repairing a number of drive subsystems meant to increase thrust efficiency, it’s possible to get the Argo up to an uncomfortable 2 g of sustained thrust.

content.original: The Argo's drive can be upgraded to allow for a severe High-G burn, but it's gonna be a strain on the System and Structure, and your budget.

content.original: The Argo's Mech Bay is vast, spacious, and meant to be entirely managed by complex automation. Currently, 6 of the 18 total 'Mech cubicles are powered and in working order, and almost none of the automation.
content.prevOriginal: The Argo's Mech Bay is vast, spacious, and meant to be entirely managed by complex automation. Currently, 6 of the 18 total 'Mech cubicles are powered and in working order, and almost none of the automation.

content.original: Mech Bay 1
content.prevOriginal: Mech Bay 1
content.content: Mech Bay 1

content.original: The repaired power conduits allow six more 'Mech cubicles to be powered up and made available. This also brings more of the Mech Bay's automated systems online, making Yang's job easier. Enables second Repair bay, allows work on a second 'Mech's at 50% efficiency.
content.prevOriginal: The repaired power conduits allow six more 'Mech cubicles to be powered up and made available. This also brings more of the Mech Bay's automated systems online, making Yang's job easier. Enables second Repair bay, allows work on a second 'Mech's at 50% efficiency.

content.original: With the Argo's power systems fully online, and enough reinforcement to keep the active Bays from damaging the ship's spine, the final 6 'Mech cubicles can be powered up and put to work. Enables third Repair bay, allows work on a third 'Mech at 33% efficiency..
content.prevOriginal: With the Argo's power systems fully online, and enough reinforcement to keep the active Bays from damaging the ship's spine, the final 6 'Mech cubicles can be powered up and put to work. Enables third Repair bay, allows work on a third 'Mech at 33% efficiency..

content.original: Mech Bay 3
content.prevOriginal: Mech Bay 3
content.content: Mech Bay 3

content.original: Many of the Argo's Mech Bay systems were only meant to be used with sophisticated Star League–era automation. Bringing that automation even partially back online is a substantial force multiplier to Yang's skills. Enables second Repair bay to work at 100% efficiency.
content.prevOriginal: Many of the Argo's Mech Bay systems were only meant to be used with sophisticated Star League–era automation. Bringing that automation even partially back online is a substantial force multiplier to Yang's skills. Enables second Repair bay to work at 100% efficiency.

content.original: Automation
content.prevOriginal: Automation
content.content: Automation

content.original: Repairs to the Mech Bay have unearthed a much more extensive system of 'Mech maintenance automation than Yang previously suspected. Once it's back online, many common tasks will become trivial. Enables third Repair bay to work at 100% efficiency.

content.original: Maintaining 'Mechs in the Succession War era is complicated by the relative rarity of precision-manufactured parts. The Argo's machine shop, once repaired and brought online, can help address this lack.

content.original: 'Mechs were not really meant to bear their own weight while being refitted with new equipment. The Argo's Mech Bay includes harnesses meant to hoist the 'Mech up for easier access while refitting.

content.original: The Argo's 'Mech cubicles used to have a complex system of movable walkways and scaffolds for accessing any part of a damaged 'Mech. Those walkways, once brought online, make the job of repairing 'Mechs much simpler.

content.original: This field hospital has a small number of beds, surgical equipment, and medical supplies. The cost includes the salary of a skilled MedTech to treat your injured MechWarriors.

content.original: This expanded field hospital allows for two MedTechs to work side by side, meaning more capacity to treat patients. The cost includes the salary of an additional skilled MedTech to treat your injured MechWarriors.
content.prevOriginal: This expanded field hospital allows for two MedTechs to work side by side, meaning more capacity to treat patients. The cost includes the salary of an additional skilled MedTech to treat your injured MechWarriors.

content.original: The fully upgraded field hospital has enough bed space, diagnostic equipment, and surgeries to allow fully half the company to be treated at once. The cost includes the salary of an additional skilled MedTech to treat your injured MechWarriors.

content.original: The original Argo specifications had room and infrastructure for actual hospital facilities, rather than just simple Med Bays. With a full hospital's worth of equipment and connections to the ship's library and databases, the MedTechs are able to perform near-miracles of healing. All Med Bays will be converted into Hospital Bays.

content.original: Each of the three pods is meant to be a mostly self-sufficient habitation space. Alpha Pod, as its interior labeling designates it, is the only one of the three to have retained its pressure seal, making its interior (mostly) habitable.
content.prevOriginal: Each of the three pods is meant to be a mostly self-sufficient habitation space. Alpha Pod, as its interior labeling designates it, is the only one of the three to have retained its pressure seal, making its interior (mostly) habitable.

content.original: Alpha Pod
content.prevOriginal: Alpha Pod
content.content: Alpha Pod

content.original: Beta Pod, once repaired, includes what was clearly once a hydroponics facility near the spine of the Argo, and a low-g gymnasium just above that. Neither survived exposure to hard vacuum and stellar radiation, but they're tantalizing indications of the luxuries the Argo once included. +10 Days before Affinities Decay.

content.original: The Argo's power system is a wreck, and getting a minimal level of power to the ship's systems without constant tripped breakers and brownouts is a minor miracle.
content.prevOriginal: The Argo's power system is a wreck, and getting a minimal level of power to the ship's systems without constant tripped breakers and brownouts is a minor miracle.
content.content: The Argo's power system is a wreck, and getting a minimal level of power to the ship's systems without constant tripped breakers and brownouts is a minor miracle.

content.original: Repaired Power Conduits
content.prevOriginal: Repaired Power Conduits
content.content: Repaired Power Conduits

content.original: Running power through patched-together conduits isn’t reliable or safe. Upgrading all the conduits throughout the Argo is a monumental task, but necessary for anything that places a significant load on the system.
content.prevOriginal: Running power through patched-together conduits isn’t reliable or safe. Upgrading all the conduits throughout the Argo is a monumental task, but necessary for anything that places a significant load on the system.

content.original: Improved Power Conduits
content.prevOriginal: Improved Power Conduits
content.content: Improved Power Conduits

content.original: The Argo was intended to operate at a much higher total power throughput than the jury-rigged conduits can manage. With this upgrade we can bring some weapons online that should help us stave of some attackers.
content.prevOriginal: The Argo was intended to operate at a much higher total power throughput than the jury-rigged conduits can manage. With this upgrade we can bring some weapons online that should help us stave of some attackers.
content.content: The Argo was intended to operate at a much higher total power throughput than the jury-rigged conduits can manage. With this upgrade we can bring some weapons online that should help us stave of some attackers.

content.original: High-Capacity Power Conduits
content.prevOriginal: High-Capacity Power Conduits
content.content: High-Capacity Power Conduits

content.original: That empty storage space in Gamma Pod, with some additional power conduits, could easily support a handful of 2-D and 3-D game systems. It's no replacement for the training units, but it's more fun.
content.prevOriginal: That empty storage space in Gamma Pod, with some additional power conduits, could easily support a handful of 2-D and 3-D game systems. It's no replacement for the training units, but it's more fun.

content.original: Arcade
content.prevOriginal: Arcade
content.content: Arcade

content.original: With some more refurbishment the Arcade can be easily upgraded to give more opportunities to relax and unwind.
content.prevOriginal: With some more refurbishment the Arcade can be easily upgraded to give more opportunities to relax and unwind.
content.content: With some more refurbishment the Arcade can be easily upgraded to give more opportunities to relax and unwind.

content.prevOriginal: Upgraded Arcade
content.content: Upgraded Arcade

content.original: MechWarriors have to maintain their physical condition, and doing so in their own quarters is claustrophobic and distracting. Luckily, the Argo has a full gymnasium, needing only repair and power.
content.prevOriginal: MechWarriors have to maintain their physical condition, and doing so in their own quarters is claustrophobic and distracting. Luckily, the Argo has a full gymnasium, needing only repair and power.

content.original: Gymnasium
content.prevOriginal: Gymnasium
content.content: Gymnasium

content.original: Now that we got the Argo gymnasium working, we can add some better Equipment and Showers.
content.prevOriginal: Now that we got the Argo gymnasium working, we can add some better Equipment and Showers.

content.original: Near the spine, the spin of the pods isn't sufficient to generate any real apparent gravity. This makes those areas bad for living in, but excellent for growing hydroponic crops. They freshen the air and add variety to mealtimes.
content.prevOriginal: Near the spine, the spin of the pods isn't sufficient to generate any real apparent gravity. This makes those areas bad for living in, but excellent for growing hydroponic crops. They freshen the air and add variety to mealtimes.

content.original: Hydroponic Garden
content.prevOriginal: Hydroponic Garden
content.content: Hydroponic Garden

content.original: More hydroponic crops means not only even fresher air, along with an greater variety to our mealtimes, but it would also reduce our monthly costs even further!

content.content: Enhanced Hydroponic Gardens

content.original: A library is more than just a database and a stack of e-readers. It requires a dedicated space for quiet study and learning, as far from the raucous lounge as possible.
content.prevOriginal: A library is more than just a database and a stack of e-readers. It requires a dedicated space for quiet study and learning, as far from the raucous lounge as possible.
content.content: A library is more than just a database and a stack of e-readers. It requires a dedicated space for quiet study and learning, as far from the raucous lounge as possible.

content.content: Library

content.original: Active subscriptions to a variety of e-book services, periodicals, and tri-vid channels make the library even more appealing to everyone.

content.original: A few couches and a table don't make for much of a social space. Drinks, 2-D video screens, and a sound system, on the other hand…

content.original: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. The Argo's internal storage is just enough for day-to-day survival, but we'll need to develop an inventory system optimized for the Argo and not just a standard DropShip. This ship's layout and functions are so different from standard that a new unified inventory system needs to be developed from scratch.
content.prevOriginal: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. The Argo's internal storage is just enough for day-to-day survival, but we'll need to develop an inventory system optimized for the Argo and not just a standard DropShip. This ship's layout and functions are so different from standard that a new unified inventory system needs to be developed from scratch.
content.content: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. The Argo's internal storage is just enough for day-to-day survival, but we'll need to develop an inventory system optimized for the Argo and not just a standard DropShip. This ship's layout and functions are so different from standard that a new unified inventory system needs to be developed from scratch.

content.original: Storage Space
content.prevOriginal: Storage Space
content.content: Storage Space

content.original: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. An optimized inventory system for the Argo is an excellent start, but we can cut storage costs further. If you're willing to front the cost for a few, rugged WorkMechs, we'd save a ton of labour and time managing our storage. This will translate into cheaper storage costs in the long run.
content.prevOriginal: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. content.original: Storage Space
content.prevOriginal: Storage Space
content.content: Storage Space

content.original: Reduces the monthly upkeep of all stored inventory items by 5%. This includes equipment, weapons, salvaged 'Mechs and stored 'Mechs. Automating the Argo's internal storage is the future. One last upgrade to the storage cells would let us move to an automated drone inventory system with a few pressurized WorkMechs for special work. Depressurizing some of our inventory and making robots do the work will save us a lot of upkeep by letting us assign the labour and resources elsewhere

content.original: This set of networked Battle Pods allow MechWarriors to compete against one another in simulated 'Mech battles, generating experience for participating MechWarriors. Each MechWarrior with less than 200,000 total experience will gain 30 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 5 points
content.prevOriginal: This set of networked Battle Pods allow MechWarriors to compete against one another in simulated 'Mech battles, generating experience for participating MechWarriors. Each MechWarrior with less than 200,000 total experience will gain 30 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 5 points
content.content: This set of networked Battle Pods allow MechWarriors to compete against one another in simulated 'Mech battles, generating experience for participating MechWarriors. Each MechWarrior with less than 200,000 total experience will gain 30 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 5 points

content.original: Training Module 1
content.prevOriginal: Training Module 1
content.content: Training Module 1

content.original: Adding more Battle Pods allows for full-lance training simulations, as well as raucous ship-wide tournaments. This increases the amount of experience gained by MechWarriors aboard the ship. Each MechWarrior with less than 500,000 total experience will gain 50 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 10 points Shift-Click a pilot in the Barracks to Retrain.
content.prevOriginal: Adding more Battle Pods allows for full-lance training simulations, as well as raucous ship-wide tournaments. This increases the amount of experience gained by MechWarriors aboard the ship. Each MechWarrior with less than 500,000 total experience will gain 50 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 10 points Shift-Click a pilot in the Barracks to Retrain.

content.original: Training Module 2
content.prevOriginal: Training Module 2
content.content: Training Module 2

content.original: With a training space completely packed with Battle Pods, MechWarriors can engage in lance-versus-lance competition, and that inevitably means teams, logos, and pennants. Large-scale competition means even more experience for participating MechWarriors. Each MechWarrior with less than 800,000 total experience will gain 80 experience points per day. Affinity decays to minimum 40 points
content.prevOriginal: With a training space completely packed with Battle Pods, MechWarriors can engage in lance-versus-lance competition, and that inevitably means teams, logos, and pennants.
